result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 4/29/15 Letter from Defendant to Judge regarding IID exemption.

Defendant Erick W Phernetton in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Erick W Phernetton in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 14CF323 & TRACKING CITATION, 14CF104, 14CF405,15CF178.

ALL CASES CALLED.
State relates agreement. 
14CF104 and 14CF405 - Judge Bitney cases scheduled for July 1, 2015 to be continued.
14CF323: .206 BAC level - nonaggravated. No collateral attacks.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court questions defendant.
14CF323: Defendant enters Guilty plea to Count 1 OWI-3rd and Count 3 .  Court accepts and finds Guilty on Count 1 and Count 3.
Court orders Count 2, Count 4, and Citation 14TR2323 DRI.

15CF178:  State relates victim's rights have been complied with,  Court orders DRI.

State relates recommendation.  

Court relates and orders: 14CF323
Count 1:
$1,694.00 Fine.  60 Days to pay or can set up payment plan.
Jail - 110 days with huber and work search - credit for 6 days.
30 months Driver's License Revocation.
30 months Ignition Interlock Device.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

Count 3:
Court Costs.  60 Days to pay or can set up payment plan.

Cash bond for case 14CF323 to be applied.

Defendant Erick W Phernetton in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Erick W Phernetton in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests recalling case later today.  Case to be recalled at 1:15 p.m. today.
14CF104, 14CF323,14CF405 to be brought in at this time also.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  

Must have no contact with Dena M.

Defendant Erick W Phernetton in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde (for today).  Defendant Erick W Phernetton in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Does not qualify for PD. Blue form given. Formal reading of the complaint waived. 
Defense moves to dismiss. Argument by State. Court denies the motion to dismiss the complaint. Argument by Defense.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 11:45 am.
